text: Switching to automatic theme detection for pages (auto.css: dark or light theme).

I removed the tag cloud on the main page again, there is a search form for that.
+ I undeleted and restored it (more faster 1 click).
The light theme is now set by default. (Because during the day, the dark theme was enabled for the browser or OS dark mode, but the light theme is more suitable).
Brought back the tag cloud on the main page (more convenient).
Privacy Badger
I removed links that cause "mindless scrolling" (hashtag cloud on the main page)
The default theme is now only "auto" (light and dark).

Ctrl+Shift+R, Ctrl+F5 or Shift+F5 - Force a hard refresh page. Refresh a webpage ignoring cache.

If you updated the page on the hosting but don't see any changes.
Neocities - Site Search
Marginalia Search - browse:random

When there are a lot of things on the site, then you start thinking about the structure: different folders for different things, and all this needs to be called somehow, and this is part of SEO. It's difficult at first, and the structure evolves and changes over time, so there will often be many pages with a 404 not found error.
It's a bit strange, but I noticed that Wikipedia uses a comma in the URL. I didn't know that a comma is standard practice for URLs.
The default is now random all light and all dark themes.

Update:
===
1. Added a tag editing button (function) for the tags list (explore panel) on the main page; tags are stored locally in the browser.
2. I added to the start page a not-so-old "speed dial" panel for the links, links stored only locally in the browser too.
Fixed the CSS style in the navigation, when the element was active, underlining was incorrect and thin.

Page refresh trick.
===
If you use a JS file and the page does not show its fresh version, open the JS file and click: reload the page button, then you will get the latest version of the page.

(Maybe the JS file is stuck in the cache, Firefox browser on PC.)
Tag Cloud Update: Added a toggle mode between special and random tags (edited).
One site with the old dark Google bar inspired me not to use my link abbreviations because no one would understand them.
Being on Neocities I see a lot of personality on the sites, mine looks too simple compared to this and I want to change it and add something.
Update. Brought back the old behavior of the input form.

Update:
- Brought the tags back on the page after removal.
- Added a change in the behavior of the search form when using a mobile phone; when typing text, the extra space at the top becomes hidden.
New page: Microblog with posts about site updates and more.
Update: The address of the pages has been changed, there may be 404 errors.
test
